Technique: WOVEN; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Mummy bandage
Description: This piece of cloth, which was purchased in the art trade of Brussels in 1935, was part of the category of bandages specifically dating from the 21st Dynasty. The hieroglyphic inscription mentions two Theban priests, Nespaneterenre and Nesamon. The first person is also known by another bandage of the same type (E.7047 C).
